ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the psychology of prejudice, and how our cognitive processes and biases control the way that we view the world around us.

I learned so much from this class! Especially with a future in psychology, this was such a necessary course to take in order to develop my thoughts surrounding the psychology behind prejudice, stereotyping, discrimination, and bias.
This course provides a really strong basis for the psychology of prejudice, you will learn a lot about the foundational theories and how it applies to the world around us.
I learned a lot about the theories behind prejudice and stereotyping, especially the cognitive and social aspect of it

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I thoroughly enjoyed this class. The people and the professor really made the experience top class.
I loved the seminar structure of this course. I thought the material was engaging and each student was thoughtful in their contribution.

Students were always willing and engaged in class discussion, and so the fact that students had to lead class every week wasn't too difficult because of how willing everyone was to help each other out in discussion.
Professor Richeson is so kind and knowledgeable!!
no weaknesses at all! the second part of the course is fully based on student presentations which is great but dr richerson is so wonderful that i would have like hearing from her more

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I recommend that everyone should take this course. It provides valuable information people must keep in mind long after they graduate Yale.

YES. take this class. it is an absolute must. Professor Richeson is incredible and such a supportive professor and knows SO much about the field. the discussions are incredibly interesting and the course is very well structured. also for the final project you can do anything that is of interest to you.

Yes! Not only is this an essential topic for all students, students of psychology will appreciate the ties to broader psychological themes and the ability to elaborate on a topic you are passionate about and its ties to prejudice research.
Absolutely! If you need a psychology senior seminar, you can't go wrong with this one.
